Package EasyNetworking.library

Class EasyServerSocket

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.net.ServerSocket
      • EasyNetworking.library.EasyServerSocket
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    EasyMultiThreadedServer 
    public class EasyServerSocket
extends java.net.ServerSocket

    EasyServerSocket - EasyServerSocket class implements simplified methods for ServerSocket,

    EasyServerSocket class implements simplified methods for ServerSocket, Simply made to make your life easier

    Since:
    2019-05-20
    Version:
    0.1
    Author:
    Hitesh Ale
    See Also:
    ServerSocket, ServerHandler

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      protected ServerHandler handler
      ServerHandler is used to hold the information of the input and output and the client Socket
      protected java.lang.String serverName  

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      EasyServerSocket​(int port)
      Calls the Constructor in ServerSocket while also setting a default timeout of 10000 milliseconds
      EasyServerSocket​(int port, java.lang.String serverName)
      Calls the Constructor in ServerSocket while also setting a default timeout of 10000 milliseconds and naming error messages

    • Constructor Detail

      • EasyServerSocket

        public EasyServerSocket​(int port)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Calls the Constructor in ServerSocket while also setting a default timeout of 10000 milliseconds
        Parameters:
        port - port number where EasyServerSocket will be created at
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Throws IOException when port cannot be allocated
        See Also:
        IOException, Constructor ServerSocket(in port)is called from this Constuctor

      • EasyServerSocket

        public EasyServerSocket​(int port,
                        java.lang.String serverName)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Calls the Constructor in ServerSocket while also setting a default timeout of 10000 milliseconds and naming error messages
        Parameters:
        port - port number where EasyServerSocket will be created at
        serverName - This serverName will name error messages allowing debugging code to be easier
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Throws IOException when port cannot be allocated
        See Also:
        IOException, Constructor ServerSocket(in port)is called from this Constuctor

    • Method Detail

      • accept

        public void accept​(boolean printOut)
        This method will allow Clients connect to the Server This method also creates a new server Handler
        Parameters:
        printOut - Determines if program will print out Server and Connected Client details
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - This can be thrown at creation of new ServerHandler when super.accept() has failed
        See Also:
        IOException, ServerHandler

      • accept

        public void accept​(int timeout,
                   boolean printOut)
        This method will allow Clients connect to the Server This method also creates a new ServerHandler
        Parameters:
        timeout - Will determine how long the server will wait for a connection in milliseconds
        printOut - Determines if program will print out Server and Connected Client details
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - This can be thrown at creation of new ServerHandler when super.accept() has failed
        See Also:
        IOException, ServerHandler

      • send

        public void send​(java.lang.Object object)
        This method allows you to send any objects to your connected Client
        Parameters:
        object - This is the object being sent to your Client

      • receive

        public java.lang.Object receive()
        This method waits until a Object is sent by a Client
        Returns:
        This returns the Object sent by the Client
